#Text=German judge orders life sentence for nation 's ' first Islamic-motivated terror attack '
#Text=Friday , February 10 , 2012
#Text=File photo of Frankfurt Airport , where the killings occurred .
#Text=A judge in Germany has ordered a man from Kosovo to be jailed for life for carrying out the " first Islamic-motivated terror attack " within the country .

event[20]	giv[20]	_	_

4-25	314-315

column1: #Text=Arid Uka , 22 , killed two US Air Force ( USAF ) men and wounded two more in a gun attack on their bus in Frankfurt .
#Text=He was convicted today .
#Text=Uka , a Kosovan who has lived in Germany since he was four , worked in Frankfurt Airport 's mail room .
#Text=He became attracted to Islamic radicalism in a matter of months and would later cite a video appearing to show US soldiers raping women in Afghanistan as his motive for the attack .
#Text=The video was not genuine .
#Text=Uka approached a USAF bus at the airport , asking a serviceman for a cigarette .
#Text=Upon learning the group was bound for Afghanistan he fatally shot the man in the head before boarding the bus with a cry of Allahu Akbar ( God is Great ) .
#Text=There , he opened fire upon more USAF airmen , killing a second and injuring two others .
#Text=The remaining eleven passengers escaped injury when his 9mm pistol jammed .
#Text=The team had been loading their bus in front of the airport during a trip that began in the United Kingdom .
#Text=The fatalities were Nicholas Alden , 25 , and Zachary Cuddeback , 21 .
#Text=Cuddeback had been the driver .
#Text=Edgar Veguilla received arm and jaw wounds while Kristoffer Schneider was left requiring reconstructive surgery for his face .
#Text=Uka 's weapon failed whilst pointed at a fifth man 's head .
#Text=Schneider has ongoing pain , blindness in one eye , a missing section of skull and a face rebuilt from titanium .
#Text=Schneider testified via videolink from a USAF base in his homeland .
#Text=Prosecution evidence included songs and text from Uka 's computer , phone , and music player .
#Text=He was said to have radicalised alone through access to material such as the fake rape film , which was actually a scene from the anti-war movie Redacted .

#Text=In sentencing Uka for murder Judge Thomas Sagebiel agreed with prosecutors there were aggravating circumstances that amounted to " particularly severe guilt , " a move likely to prevent parole after fifteen years as is normally possible with German life sentences .
#Text=It is the maximum possible sentence .
#Text=The judge said the attack was aggravated by its ambush nature , that unarmed men were attacked and Alden was also attacked from behind , and that the wounds inflicted were serious .
#Text=Sagebiel also noted Uka 's refusal to explain how he acquired the gun .
#Text=There was no drug or alcohol use involved , and no evidence Uka had been trained for the attack .
#Text=The killer described himself to the court as spending much of his time on computers , with few friends and a largely non-religious family background .
#Text=He sat motionless with his eyes down and arms folded during the 70-minute verdict and sentencing hearing .
#Text=Uka had not joined any radical organisations and the defence claimed he was not a terrorist .
#Text=Last year he blamed inaccurate propaganda for having influenced him and apologised , claiming not to understand his own actions .
#Text=His defence lawyer , Michaela Roth , also sought to have his youth , admissions , and a troubled childhood considered .
#Text=Roth had suggested sexual abuse when Uka was six had led to a return of trauma when he saw the falsified rape video .
#Text=This was undermined by psychiatric expert opinion , a report finding the abuse — and the video — of no " decisive relevance " .

column1: #Text=He was aware when he killed , and did not have a personality disorder although he was of " an immature personality , " it concluded .

#Text=" The attack was not only cowardly and perfidious , but also damaged Germany 's reputation , " said Sagebiel , telling victims and their relatives he " hoped that by our bringing the perpetrator to justice swiftly , you can find some comfort ... and will not harbour any rancour towards Germany . "
#Text=Alden 's brother Joe was in court and later said " justice has been served . "
